properties.areaDesc: Sterling; Coleman; Callahan; Taylor; Nolan; Fisher; Coke; Haskell; Jones; Shackelford; Runnels; Throckmorton
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 10 at 4:42AM CST by NWS San Angelo TX
properties.description:
Following a cold frontal passage this evening and early tonight,
much colder air will invade the area. Temperatures will quickly
drop into the 30 to 35 degree range overnight and early Saturday
morning. With brisk north to northwest winds, wind chill values
will be in the 15 to 20 degree range across most of the Big
Country, and 20 to 25 degrees south into northern Sterling, Coke,
Runnels and Coleman Counties.

Light wintry precipitation will be possible late tonight and early
Saturday morning, as an upper level storm system moves across the
area. A few rain showers are possible prior to Midnight, with a
change to light snow or show showers after Midnight and into early
Saturday morning. With warm ground conditions, little to no snow
accumulation is expected. Anyone planning travel late tonight and
early Saturday morning will want to be aware of the possibility
for a few slick spots on some bridges and overpasses. Stay tuned
for the latest updates and forecasts on this upcoming weather
change.

Conditions will quickly improve by late Saturday morning, when
clearing skies are expected with temperatures climbing into the
upper 30s to lower 40s across the area.

NWSheadline: MUCH COLDER WITH LIGHT WINTRY PRECIPITATION POSSIBLE LATE TONIGHT AND EARLY SATURDAY MORNING
